body: I investigated this but found it difficult to decide what to do about it. Half the timezones on the planet are negative. Some timezones are off from their neighbors by 30 minutes, though none are -59 minutes, but that's not a bug, just an unused feature. So for TZ there's nothing to do. For year, it would be possible to return an error when a negative year is parsed. But what error is this saving users of the stdlib from? I find it to be a borderline case, and I'm leaning towards "works as intended".
